unnormalised: Delhivery's latest address snafu has left one Mr. R. Sharma of 123 Gandhi Nagar, Delhi, 110031, scratching his head. Instead of receiving his much-awaited new pressure cooker, it seems his package took a scenic tour of India, ending up at 456 Nehru Street, Kolkata, 700001, with a Mrs. Banerjee who, reportedly, already owns three pressure cookers!
normalised: Delhivery's latest address snafu has left one Mister R. Sharma of one hundred and twenty three Gandhi Nagar, Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and thirty one, scratching his head. Instead of receiving his much awaited new pressure cooker, it seems his package took a scenic tour of India, ending up at four hundred and fifty six Nehru Street, Kolkata, seven hundred thousand and one, with a Missus Banerjee who, reportedly, already owns three pressure cookers!

unnormalised: The courier company, when contacted, simply stated "Address mein kuch toh gadbad hai, bhai!" (There's some issue with the address, brother!). No kidding! They did, however, promise to reroute the package… eventually. Sources say Mr. Sharma is now considering simply moving to Kolkata to avoid future delivery mishaps.
normalised: The courier company, when contacted, simply stated "Address mein kuch toh gadbad hai, bhai!" (There's some issue with the address, brother!). No kidding! They did, however, promise to reroute the package… eventually. Sources say Mister Sharma is now considering simply moving to Kolkata to avoid future delivery mishaps.

unnormalised: In related news, a spokesperson for "Confused Parcel Express" (not the real name, of course) suggested customers "double, triple, even quadruple-check" their pin codes before placing orders. "Aapka address sahi hona chahiye, warna parcel kahin bhi jaa sakta hai!" (Your address should be correct, otherwise the parcel can go anywhere!), they warned, seemingly oblivious to the irony.

"Aapka address sahi hona chahiye, warna parcel kahin bhi jaa sakta hai!" (Your address should be correct, otherwise the parcel can go anywhere!), they warned, seemingly oblivious to the irony.
